meanings.definition: To convert (organic matter) into carbon or a carbonaceous residue.
meanings.sent1: The wood was carbonized in the fire, turning it into charcoal.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization carbonized wood to create tools and art.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally carbonized the vegetables, creating a unique smoky flavor.
meanings.sent4: Her anger carbonized his heart, leaving only ashes of their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat of the volcano carbonized everything in its path, leaving a barren landscape.

meanings.definition: To char (organic matter) until it forms carbon.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith carbonized the iron to strengthen it for the sword.
meanings.sent2: The fire slowly carbonized the fallen leaves, turning them into ash.
meanings.sent3: The baker accidentally carbonized the bread, making it extra crispy.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays seemed to carbonize the surface of the old painting, giving it a dark hue.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat of the desert sun can quickly carbonize any exposed plant matter.

meanings.sent1: The organic matter began to carbonize under the pressure and heat.
meanings.sent2: The wood slowly carbonized over time, becoming fossilized.
meanings.sent3: The experiment unexpectedly caused the substance to carbonize, surprising the scientists.
meanings.sent4: The fallen tree started to carbonize in the damp forest, slowly decaying into the ground.
meanings.sent5: The ancient manuscript started to carbonize due to improper storage, risking its preservation.
